intro: Seseli jomuticum, commonly known as the Turkish seseli, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits called schizocarps, which split into two parts when mature. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Seseli jomuticum is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
